alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 1:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Bell, southwestern Knox and east central Whitley Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 152 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Louden, or 8 miles east of Williamsburg, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Goins and Hubbs around 200 PM EDT. Frakes and Kayjay around 205 PM EDT. Chenoa, Davisburg, Wheeler, Fonde and Ingram around 210 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Clear Creek Springs, Noetown, Middlesboro, Binghamtown, Meldrum, Ferndale and Hutch. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 1 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
